meanings.definition: Needless repetition of an idea, especially in words closely related in meaning.
meanings.sent1: Her constant use of tautologous phrases made her writing difficult to follow.
meanings.sent2: The tautologous nature of his speech made it hard to discern his main point.
meanings.sent3: The tautologous arguments in the debate were so repetitive that the audience started to doze off.
meanings.sent4: His tautologous explanations were like a broken record, repeating the same information over and over.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's tautologous lectures were as monotonous as a dripping faucet.

meanings.sent1: Her essay was criticized for its tautologous use of unnecessary words.
meanings.sent2: The tautologous statement added no new information to the discussion.
meanings.sent3: His tautologous insistence on repeating himself in every sentence became comical after a while.
meanings.sent4: The tautologous design of the building made it look like a copy of every other structure in the area.
meanings.sent5: The tautologous signs pointing in the same direction confused the lost travelers even more.
